know how to evoke the diagnosis of a fracture without excessive manipulation of the limb, know how to immediately prescribe temporary immobilisation, know how to prescribe a level 2 or 3 painkiller in children, know how to locate the lesion and prescribe imaging targeted at the region concerned.

properties.question: In the initial management of a child with a suspected fracture, which of the following is the most appropriate immediate action?
properties.option_a: Perform a detailed physical examination to identify the exact type of fracture.
properties.option_b: Immediately prescribe a level 2 or 3 painkiller and provide temporary immobilization.
properties.option_c: Apply heat to the affected area to reduce pain before any imaging is done.
properties.option_d: Encourage the child to move the limb to assess the extent of the injury.
